basics.name: Paul Mattheneus
basics.label: Health Economist & Generative AI Software Engineer
basics.summary: Health Economist & Generative AI Software Engineer specializing in pharmaceutical operations with MSc in Pharmaceutical Biosciences and Health Economics. Delivered $1M+ annual savings through automated technical report generation and enterprise AI solutions at Bristol Myers Squibb. Proven track record of transforming complex pharmaceutical challenges into competitive advantages through cutting-edge AI implementations.

work.name: Bristol Myers Squibb
work.position: Generative AI Software Engineer & Biostatistics Expert
work.description: Leading pharmaceutical company focused on discovering, developing and delivering innovative medicines for patients with serious diseases.
work.summary: Spearheading enterprise AI transformation initiatives delivering $1M+ annual savings through automated pharmaceutical solutions.
highlights: Developed Adaptive Integrated Codebase AI Agent transforming maintenance from slow, manual process into rapid, prompt-driven workflow with 10x productivity potential
Built MAIC Generative AI Platform eliminating external consultancy dependencies through automated technical report generation
Created first-of-its-kind Healthcare AI Evidence Reliability Assessment System quantifying AI-generated healthcare report reliability
Implemented multi-modal AI engine with Claude Vision API integration and automated evidence synthesis
Designed hybrid validation system with cross-referencing architecture ensuring 99.9% accuracy for healthcare decision-making
Established enterprise-ready solutions integrating seamlessly across R and Python applications company-wide

work.name: Bristol Myers Squibb
work.description: Health Technology Assessment specialist focusing on Nordic market access strategies.
work.summary: Developed expertise in crafting Health Technology Assessment reimbursement dossiers for Nordic markets.
highlights: Key contributor to securing reimbursement for Opdivo as adjuvant therapy for esophageal carcinoma patients
Shaped new Swedish reimbursement procedures for PDL1-1 inhibitors in the adjuvant setting
Built and maintained IPD database for BMS Nordics Market Affiliate integrating clinical data and analytics tools
Developed comprehensive HTA reimbursement dossiers across multiple Nordic healthcare systems

work.name: Parexel
work.position: Associate Manager, HTA and Cost Effectiveness Modelling
work.description: Global clinical research organization providing comprehensive biopharmaceutical services.
work.summary: Developed Cost-Effectiveness and Budget-Impact Models for major pharmaceutical companies.
highlights: Developed comprehensive cost-effectiveness and budget-impact models for leading pharmaceutical companies
Communicated value of new pharmaceutical interventions to enhance market access
Engaged with stakeholders to facilitate informed decision-making and promote product adoption
Effectively communicated value of new pharmaceutical interventions to drive market access and stakeholder engagement

projects.name: Healthcare AI Evidence Reliability Assessment System
projects.description: First-of-its-kind system to quantify reliability and robustness of AI-generated healthcare reports, transforming AI adoption from experimental to mission-critical.
highlights: Multi-metric validation framework with weighted healthcare reliability scoring
Healthcare-specific quality assurance ensuring regulatory and HTA-level standards
Enables confident healthcare decision-making through quantified AI report reliability
Enterprise impact transforming AI adoption in regulated environments

projects.name: Enterprise AI Architecture Leadership

highlights: 6 years at Bristol Myers Squibb with 10+ years pharmaceutical expertise
Cross-functional impact empowering PMs, analysts, and domain experts
Strategic vision transforming single innovations into company-wide competitive advantages
AI democratization enabling non-technical teams to leverage advanced AI capabilities
